title: Deadly, sombre Good Friday as 58 people killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza
snippets: Palestinian Christians in Gaza and the occupied West Bank are holding temperate gatherings leading up to Easter.
titles: Deadly, sombre Good Friday as 58 people killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza
summary: Palestinian Christians in Gaza and the occupied West Bank are conducting modest gatherings in anticipation of Easter. These events are characterized by their restrained nature, reflecting the community's approach to the holiday period under the current circumstances.

title: One dead after protests against KFC branches in Pakistan
snippets: Protesters, angry at the war in Gaza, have claimed KFC is a symbol of the United States and its ally Israel.
titles: One dead after protests against KFC branches in Pakistan
summary: Protesters critical of the war in Gaza have targeted KFC, labeling it as a symbol of the United States and its alliance with Israel. This reflects broader discontent with American foreign policy and its implications in the region.

title: Ukraine minerals deal may not buy peace after Trump threat
snippets: As Trump threatens to walk from peace talks, a mineral deal looks unlikely to offer Ukraine security.
titles: Ukraine minerals deal may not buy peace after Trump threat
summary: Former President Trump has indicated a potential withdrawal from peace negotiations, casting doubt on the prospects of a mineral deal that was considered a potential security benefit for Ukraine. This development suggests that the anticipated agreement aimed at enhancing Ukraine's security may not materialize as hoped.

title: At least two killed in Israeli strikes on southern Lebanon
snippets: Israel has continued to conduct near-daily strikes in Lebanon despite a ceasefire with Hezbollah last November.
titles: At least two killed in Israeli strikes on southern Lebanon
summary: Israel has been carrying out almost daily airstrikes in Lebanon, despite agreeing to a ceasefire with Hezbollah in November. This ongoing activity indicates that the ceasefire has not halted military actions between the two parties.

title: Did Xi Jinping succeed in winning support against Trump’s tariff war?
snippets: Chinese president visits three Southeast Asian nations amid global uncertainty.
titles: Did Xi Jinping succeed in winning support against Trump’s tariff war?
summary: The Chinese president embarked on a diplomatic tour, visiting three Southeast Asian countries. This move comes at a time marked by global uncertainty, emphasizing China's effort to strengthen ties and assert its influence in the region. The visit aims to foster diplomatic and economic relations amidst the current international landscape.

title: Southern wins 2nd straight area championship
snippets: OAKLAND — After compiling a 24-3 record and finishing as state runner-up for a second straight year, Southern was the runaway pick to repeat as Area champion. The Rams, who went unbeaten in the area, were unanimously selected by a panel of local sportswriters. “It’s really cool,” Southern head coach Landon Todd said, “especially to be outright Area champs after splitting (votes) with Mountain ...
titles: Southern wins 2nd straight area championship
summary: The Southern Rams were unanimously chosen by local sportswriters to repeat as Area champions in Oakland, after an impressive season with a 24-3 record and finishing as state runner-up for the second consecutive year. They achieved this feat while going unbeaten in their area. Head coach Landon Todd expressed pride in the team's achievement, especially being recognized as outright Area champs following a previous split in votes.

title: James Harden believes players around NBA want Shai Gilgeous-Alexander to win MVP
snippets: James Harden believes players around the NBA want Shai Gilgeous-Alexander to win MVP.
titles: James Harden believes players around NBA want Shai Gilgeous-Alexander to win MVP
summary: James Harden has expressed that there is a widespread sentiment among NBA players supporting Shai Gilgeous-Alexander for the MVP award. This indicates a notable level of respect and recognition for Gilgeous-Alexander's performance from his professional peers.

title: Mets top prospect Brandon Sproat throws six scoreless innings in third straight strong Triple-A outing
snippets: Mets top prospect Brandon Sproat appears to be finding his groove in Triple-A, as he put together his third straight strong start on Friday.
titles: Mets top prospect Brandon Sproat throws six scoreless innings in third straight strong Triple-A outing
summary: Brandon Sproat, the Mets' top prospect, has delivered his third consecutive strong performance in Triple-A, showcasing his potential growth and consistency at this level. This recent outing on Friday adds to his positive trajectory in the minor leagues.

title: All-NBA team predictions: Will any OKC Thunder players join Shai Gilgeous-Alexander?
snippets: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is a lock to be first-team All-NBA, but will Lu Dort make All-Defensive first team? How about Jalen Williams for All-NBA?
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is a lock to be first-team All-NBA, but will Lu Dort make All-Defensive first team? How about Jalen Williams for All-NBA?
titles: All-NBA team predictions: Will any OKC Thunder players join Shai Gilgeous-Alexander?
All-NBA team predictions: Will any OKC Thunder players join Shai Gilgeous-Alexander?
summary: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is confirmed to be on the first-team All-NBA, showcasing his exceptional performance. However, the potential inclusion of Lu Dort on the All-Defensive first team and Jalen Williams for All-NBA remains uncertain, indicating their achievements are recognized but final decisions are pending.

title: Leeds claim vital win over Oxford to return top
snippets: Leeds United climbed back to the summit of the Championship with a victory over Oxford United, keeping pace with earlier wins on Friday by Burnley and Sheffield United.A first-half strike from Manor S...
titles: Leeds claim vital win over Oxford to return top
summary: Leeds United returned to the top of the Championship standings after defeating Oxford United, thanks to a first-half goal from Manor Solomon. This win allows them to keep up with Burnley and Sheffield United, who also secured victories on Friday.

title: Wall Street slashes stock market forecasts amid Trump tariff fears
snippets: Banks expect gain of just 2% for S&P 500 this year, with JPMorgan and BofA among those lowering estimates
titles: Wall Street slashes stock market forecasts amid Trump tariff fears
summary: Several banks, including JPMorgan and Bank of America, have revised their forecasts for the S&P 500, now expecting a modest gain of just 2% for the year. This adjustment reflects a more cautious outlook on the stock market's potential growth.

title: Trump will abandon Ukraine peace talks ‘in days’ without progress, warns Rubio
snippets: Warning comes after Emmanuel Macron hosted US, Ukraine and other allies for round of negotiations
titles: Trump will abandon Ukraine peace talks ‘in days’ without progress, warns Rubio
summary: Hours before JD Vance expressed optimism about a potential breakthrough, the US Secretary of State issued a warning regarding the situation. Despite Vance's hopeful outlook, the Secretary of State's caution underscores the complexity and uncertainty of the circumstances.

title: Which American Jobs Are Most Likely To Be Affected As China Responds To Trump's Tariffs?
snippets:
KEY TAKEAWAYS

  • An escalating trade war with China, where one of the U.S.'s top trading partners placed a 125% tariff on American goods, will likely make it more expensive for American companies to export products to China.
  • American companies will likely slow hiring, and Trump's tariffs are expected to reduce manufacturing employment by 500,000.
  • The trade war will most likely impact farmers and agriculture companies, as the majority of the $150 billion in goods the U.S. exports to China, is made up of agricultural products.


Exports to China support thousands of U.S. jobs, and economists say those positions could be at risk if trade tensions between the two countries continue.

In an escalating trade war with China, the U.S. has a tariff of 145% on Chinese goods, and China has placed a tariff of 125% on U.S. goods. Economists say these trade tensions will likely make it more expensive for American businesses to import and export Chinese goods and could threaten the labor market.

According to a report by the U.S.-China Business Council, in 2022, an estimated 931,231 American jobs were supported by exports to China. However, hiring and jobs in sectors most exposed to Chinese trade could be in danger if the two countries cannot reach a long-term trade deal and elevated tariffs persist.

A trade war could negatively impact American workers in sectors that rely on exports to China
Sector Jobs
Oilseeds and Grains178,736
Education117,161
Meat Products32,396
Aerospace Products and Parts28,963
Semiconductors and Components28,791
Miscellaneous Crops28,391
Pharmaceuticals and Medicines26,081
Industrial Machinery24,373
Navigational and Measuring Instruments22,961
Motor Vehicles21,873
Oil and Gas21,187
Medical Equipment and Supplies20,929
Miscellaneous Personal and Recreational18,636
Royalties from Industrial Processes16,286
Miscellaneous Business, Professional & Technology Services14,974
Pulp and Paperboard Mill Products13,274
Miscellaneous General Purpose Machinery12,678
Petroleum and Coal Products12,011
Personal Travel and Tourism11,470
Basic Chemicals11,404

Tariffs have not hit the labor market yet; in March, few private-sector companies reported large-scale layoffs. However, as Trump's back-and-forth tariffs continue to create uncertainty, Goldman Sachs economists say hiring will likely be the first economic element to feel the effects.

Chinese Tariffs On US Exports Could Hurt Farmers, Ranchers Most

More than one-fourth of the jobs that could be affected by Chinese tariffs on U.S. goods rely on agricultural trade with China. Farmers are worried they won't be able to afford to sell to their previous trading partners. That could potentially, in turn, affect how they hire and fire workers.

"Farmers Union has always fought for fair trading relationships with other countries," said Rob Larew, president of the National Farmers Union, in a statement on April 2. "We rely on stable markets and fair competition to thrive, but the administration’s actions today create instability at the expense of our family farmers."

The Trump administration has discussed some emergency aid to farmers, as it did during its trade war with China in 2018, according to the New York Times. However, no aid has been put in place yet.
titles: Which American Jobs Are Most Likely To Be Affected As China Responds To Trump's Tariffs?
summary: The escalating trade war between the U.S. and China, marked by mutual tariffs of 145% by the U.S. on Chinese goods and 125% by China on U.S. goods, threatens significant economic impacts. American companies face increased costs in exporting products to China, potentially leading to a reduction in manufacturing employment by 500,000 jobs. The agriculture sector, a major component of the $150 billion in goods the U.S. exports to China, is especially at risk, with over a quarter of the jeopardized jobs related to agricultural trade. Despite the current lack of large-scale layoffs, the uncertainty

title: Dubai chocolate sparks pistachio shortage as TikTokers go nuts
snippets: Global kernel prices surge by a third as demand for viral cream-filled bars strains supplies
titles: Dubai chocolate sparks pistachio shortage as TikTokers go nuts
summary: Global kernel prices have surged by a third due to increased demand for cream-filled bars that have gone viral, putting pressure on supplies. This significant price increase reflects the growing consumer interest in these popular snacks and the resulting strain on kernel resources.

title: UK must expand its Arctic military position, defence review to say
snippets: State-backed report will call for more investment in drones and tech in a new era of state conflict
titles: UK must expand its Arctic military position, defence review to say
summary: A state-backed report recommends increased investment in drones and technology to address the challenges of a new era of state conflict. The report emphasizes the need for advancements in these areas to enhance national security and defense capabilities.

title: New colour seen for the first time by tricking the eyes
snippets: A device has enabled people to see a new a shade of blue-green, which they say is more intense than any experienced before
titles: New colour seen for the first time by tricking the eyes
summary: A new device has been developed that allows users to see a unique shade of blue-green, described as more intense than any previously known colors. This innovation has enabled people to experience a color they had not been able to perceive before.

title: Claims of alien life are overhyped – and miss the real accomplishment
snippets: Whenever there’s even a slight chance that an exoplanet shows signs of biological activity, people understandably get excited – but it’s never been aliens, and we shouldn’t jump to conclusions, not this time or the next, says Chris Lintott
titles: Claims of alien life are overhyped – and miss the real accomplishment
summary: Astronomer Chris Lintott cautions against prematurely concluding that signs of biological activity on exoplanets indicate alien life. Despite public excitement over potential discoveries, Lintott emphasizes the importance of not jumping to conclusions, as past instances of suspected biological activity have never been linked to aliens.

title: Quantum GPS can help planes navigate when regular GPS is jammed
snippets: A quantum sensor using Earth's magnetic fields outperformed standard GPS backups in test flights. This technology could help commercial aircraft stay on course amid a rise in GPS jamming and spoofing attacks
titles: Quantum GPS can help planes navigate when regular GPS is jammed
summary: A quantum sensor leveraging Earth's magnetic fields has surpassed traditional GPS backups in test flights, offering a promising solution for commercial aircraft navigation. This advancement is particularly significant in the context of increasing GPS jamming and spoofing attacks, ensuring that planes can maintain their course accurately without relying solely on GPS technology.

title: Artificial light pollution could fuel growth of toxic algal blooms
snippets: The "skyglow" produced when light from cities bounces off clouds can help cyanobacteria and other aquatic microbes grow at night
titles: Artificial light pollution could fuel growth of toxic algal blooms
summary: Skyglow, the phenomenon where city lights reflect off clouds, has been found to aid the nighttime growth of cyanobacteria and other aquatic microbes. This effect occurs as the artificial light increases, providing conditions conducive for microbial growth during periods that would naturally be dark.

title: A wearable smart insole can track how you walk, run and stand
snippets: A new smart insole system that monitors how people walk in real time could help users improve posture and provide early warnings for conditions from plantar fasciitis to Parkinson's disease.
titles: A wearable smart insole can track how you walk, run and stand
summary: A newly developed smart insole system offers real-time monitoring of users' walking patterns, aiming to enhance posture and provide early alerts for various conditions, including plantar fasciitis and Parkinson's disease. This technology is designed to assist users in identifying and addressing potential health issues related to their gait, potentially improving their overall well-being.
